a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:50:"Task 2 Writing - Identifying Different Question Types";s:7:"content";s:945:"IELTS Task 2 Writing questions come in different types, each requiring a different approach: 1. Give an opinion / challenge a point of view - Questions that ask 'Do you agree or disagree?' or 'Do you think...?' or 'To what extent do you agree?' require you to state your position and support it. 2. Compare points of view - Questions that present two opposing views and ask you to 'Discuss both views and give your opinion' require you to explain both perspectives before stating your own position. 3. Give solutions to a problem - Questions that ask 'What can be done about this?' or 'How can this problem be solved?' require you to suggest practical solutions and explain how they would work. 4. Discuss a given situation - Questions that ask 'Why do you think this is?' or 'What are the reasons for this?' require you to analyze and explain causes or reasons behind a situation or trend.";}}
